model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I'm pretty excited! They just added one of my favorite dishes to the menu at work. I can't wait for my next shift so I can try it for free. I will send you a pic later, ok? 
Speaker B: Okay, yes, please send me a pic as soon as you can. I can't wait to see it. What is the name of the dish?
Speaker A: It's a Chicken parmesan, with a red pepper marinara. It's so crisp and juicy-I love it! They serve it with these sweet roasted asparagus!
Speaker B: Oh that sounds absolutely fabulous. Are you going to get a free dessert, as well?
Speaker A: Yes, I am thinking about trying either the new eclairs, or their tres leches cake with fresh raspberry jam sauce and lemon drizzle! I have too many good options to pick from! What one would you pick?
Speaker B: Hands down, I would pick the tres leches. Ever since I tried it a few years ago, it has always been my favorite dessert.

[MEMORY]
Speaker A works at a restaurant and invited Speaker B to visit. Speaker A enjoys working at the restaurant despite the busy schedule. Speaker A gets two free meals per week, along with taking home leftover baked goods.

prediction:
Brief explanation: The information in MEMORY provides useful background details about Speaker A's employment and benefits. Given the context where Speaker A discusses about a new dish at their work and a possible dessert choice, knowing that Speaker A works at a restaurant and gets two free meals per week can be valuable in forming a coherent response.
Judgement: Yes
